issue.title: Bitcoin Core does not display properly on High-DPI Windows 10 systems
issue.body:
![Bitcoin Core High-DPI bug](http://i.imgur.com/FKLpTtj.png)

The text is unreadable to the point where I can't even see my balance.

I have a 4K display, that is set to 200% scaling. Which means it's effectively behaving like a regular 1080p monitor, but it's lovely to read on as text is much cleaner.

issue.title: Showing very tiny font in the Debug console tab

events.body: Does windows 10 have DPI settings like 7 did? If so, try increasing the DPI-adjustment or whatever it is named now all the way up and make sure that doesn't fix it. Qt attempts to be as friendly (camouflaged) to the host environment as possible but sometimes strange things happen with weird resolutions I have noticed.
This problem can be reproduced under Linux by launching bitcoin-qt with QT_DEVICE_PIXEL_RATIO=2.

Thank you
On Feb 11, 2016 1:40 PM, "Thomas Daede" notifications@github.com wrote:

> This problem can be reproduced under Linux by launching bitcoin-qt with
> QT_DEVICE_PIXEL_RATIO=2.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7341#issuecomment-183068772.

Looks like a bug in the upstream Qt library.
See also issue #6472.
Qt's <=5.5 HiDPI support only works properly on MacOSX. Qt 5.6 Beta looks promising (check: http://blog.qt.io/blog/2015/12/18/qt-5-6-beta-released/).

Thanks for the information jonas. Does this require rebuilding Bitcoin Core against QT 5.6 beta, or is there some way to have the v0.11.2 client use 5.6 beta given that it's installed? I'm just a user and not a QT or Bitcoin developer.
@cosmicvibe: Yes. It needs a build of BitcoinQt against Qt5.6 beta. You can download Qt5.6 beta from here: https://download.qt.io/development_releases/qt/5.6/5.6.0-beta/

issue.title: Qt client window can not be resized, content cut off
issue.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1227833/11316910/160ae388-901a-11e5-9ec6-220a3f7531f2.png)
This is on debian linux with QT 4.8.7+dfsg-4

events.body:
@jonasschnelli  Thank you, that helped a lot! This is a very late reply, but I'm pretty sure I didn't rebuild BT Core after installing QT 5.6 to get the larger text.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3385925/14625038/a4b43e6e-05ad-11e6-8cc0-380c1179f044.png)
Should be much better now when compiled against Qt5.6.1 (which is now our depends default QT version).

issue.title: Serval HiDPI issues on Linux and Windows
issue.body: Somehow I expected that Qt upstream does handle the HiDPI differences. It looks like that handling HiDPI correctly would require some streamlining in our code. Splashscreen HiDPI Window8 NOK Linux NOK: ![bildschirmfoto-2015-07-24-um-12 16 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/8872504/d9cf262e-31fd-11e5-8658-b3cf606b8888.jpg) OSX OK: Icon big/small mix: Linux NOK: OSX OK: Linux Menu Icons wrong size: ![bildschirmfoto-2015-07-24-um-12 17 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/8872517/fe928564-31fd-11e5-9937-812a42787035.jpg)

events.body: Closing due to Qt 5.6.1 switch which addresses this (#8210).

issue.title: Windows Wallet HiDPI (4k) Display Issue
issue.body:
Windows Wallet

- Text Display Issue, small or half lines of text are shown on 4k display.
- Icons down bottom right also are very small.
- Overall scale of the wallet could be better, but the menu items and title are normal size.

![mintcapture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10786577/36840959-df5db96c-1d9a-11e8-84de-41a928961b3e.JPG)

issue.title: Font too small in high resolution display
issue.body:
For example in my Linux laptop displaying QHD+ (WQXGA+, 3200x1800), which I set to 210 DPI, the fonts are about 3 times smaller than in the other apps.

Some other wallets like ZCoin (zcoin-qt) can adjust to the font DPI setting.

issue.title: QT font issues no matter the display option
issue.body:
I've seen font issues forever in dash-qt. Unsure what the real culprit is, but this example is the most egregious, I think...

Fedora LInux 28
QT 5.11.1
Hardware: QHD+ screen at something like 2048 x 1152
Window Manager: GNOME 3.28
Display server: Wayland, but...
dash-qt set to use X11 display server protocol (as opposed to Wayland which has issues with QT5)

Note: dash-qt using DASH-traditional is definitely the best user experience (fonts, spacing, etc, but still screws up this screen.

Image...
![screenshot from 2018-12-18 07-48-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6908872/50155982-84a36d00-029b-11e9-9628-e3a87c5afd67.png)
